VIII. Other Support: There is currently no other support available for
this project, nor has this project been submitted to any other agency or
organization. The National Association of Educational Broadcasters and its
Affiliates participating in this project will provide the necessary adminis¬
trative and supervisory support in addition to those items listed above* This
is not an extension of nor addition to any previous project supported by the
U. S. Office of Education*
IX. How the Kits Would be Used: The purpose of this project is broadly
defined as making available to local groups materials to help them develop
or improve classroom utilization of Educational broadcasts. The kits are
primarily intended to be used with groups but this would not preclude indi¬
vidual use*
The list of sample kit ideas in Section II of this proposal is not
intended to limit the project but merely to suggest the various types of
materials to be included in the kits* It is expected that during the explor¬
ation phase many new ideas and needs will be identified and clarified. These
will not all be of equal value and one of the most important s teps in the
exploration phase will be the assigning of priorities to the various pro¬
ductions •
Each kit will be developed with a specific audience or use in mind*
Some form of total organization will be developed after the field is surveyed*
Developing this total approach will be one of the primary functions of the
NAEB Utilization Committee. The budget for Phase I includes the expenses
for a meeting of this committee to screen ideas, to develop an overall plan,
and to make specific production plans. A tentative organization plan for the
kits is suggested belowj
Three classes of kits would be developed. The first of these would
be designed for use in locations.where educational broadcasts have never
been used. In addition to specific utilization examples these kits would
include basic information and materials about the educational broadcasting
field. Different presentations would be developed for use with school
boards, school administrators, curriculum directors, classroom teachers, and
parent-community groups. Considerable emphasis would be placed on research
findings, organization and general classroom utilization examples from many
different locations.
The second set of kits would be planned for use where there is a
history of educational broadcasting. These would deal with ideas and sug¬
gestions to*help the local schools improve the utilization of the broadcasts.
The materials used in these kits would be more advanced and sophisticated.
These materials would also be produced with a specific audience in mind.
The third set of kits would be organized to provide material for utilization
workshops and courses*
While this plan calls for three separate sets of kits it is antici¬
pated that in some cases a kit could serve several different audiences*
Material from one kit could be reorganized to serve a different purpose or
audience. Every effort will be made to keep the individual kits specific
with only one objective and one audience in mind*
